title.en: House of King Goujian of Yue
title.raw: 《越王句踐世家》 House of King Goujian of Yue

sentences.zh: 越王句踐，其先禹之苗裔，而夏后帝少康之庶子也。

translations.literal: King Goujian of Yue was a descendant of Yu the Great, and an illegitimate son of Emperor Shao Kang of the Xia dynasty.

sentences.zh: 封於會稽，以奉守禹之祀。

translations.literal: He was enfeoffed at Kuaiji to maintain the sacrifices to Yu.

sentences.zh: 文身斷發，披草萊而邑焉。

translations.literal: They tattooed their bodies, cut their hair, and built settlements among the grass and weeds.

sentences.zh: 後二十餘世，至於允常。

translations.literal: After more than twenty generations, it came to Yun Chang.

sentences.zh: 允常之時，與吳王闔廬戰而相怨伐。

translations.literal: During Yun Chang's time, he fought with King He Lü of Wu and they resented each other, attacking back and forth.

sentences.zh: 允常卒，子句踐立，是為越王。

translations.literal: Yun Chang died, and his son Goujian succeeded him, becoming King of Yue.

King Goujian of Yue was a descendant of Yu the Great, and an illegitimate son of Emperor Shao Kang of the Xia dynasty. He was enfeoffed at Kuaiji to maintain the sacrifices to Yu. His people tattooed their bodies and cut their hair, dwelling among the weeds and grass in their settlement. After more than twenty generations, it came to Yun Chang. During Yun Chang's time, he fought with King He Lü of Wu and they resented each other, attacking back and forth. Yun Chang died, and his son Goujian succeeded him, becoming King of Yue.

sentences.zh: 元年，吳王闔廬聞允常死，乃興師伐越。

translations.literal: In his first year, King He Lü of Wu heard that Yun Chang had died, so he raised troops to attack Yue.

sentences.zh: 越王句踐使死士挑戰，三行，至吳陳，呼而自剄。

translations.literal: King Goujian of Yue sent suicide troops to challenge them. They advanced in three rows to the Wu battle line, shouting as they slit their own throats.

sentences.zh: 吳師觀之，越因襲擊吳師，吳師敗於檇李，射傷吳王闔廬。

translations.literal: The Wu army watched this spectacle, and Yue took advantage to attack the Wu forces, defeating them at Gan Li and wounding King He Lü with arrows.

sentences.zh: 闔廬且死，告其子夫差曰：「必毋忘越。」

translations.literal: He Lü was about to die and told his son Fu Chai: 'You must never forget Yue.'

In his first year, King He Lü of Wu heard that Yun Chang had died, so he raised troops to attack Yue. King Goujian of Yue sent suicide troops to challenge them. They advanced in three rows to the Wu battle line, shouting as they slit their own throats. The Wu army watched this spectacle, and Yue took advantage to attack the Wu forces, defeating them at Gan Li and wounding King He Lü with arrows. He Lü was about to die and told his son Fu Chai: 'You must never forget Yue.'

sentences.zh: 三年，句踐聞吳王夫差日夜勒兵，且以報越，越欲先吳未發往伐之。

translations.literal: In the third year, Goujian heard that King Fu Chai of Wu was training his troops day and night, intending to avenge himself on Yue. Yue wanted to strike first before Wu could mobilize.

sentences.zh: 范蠡諫曰：「不可。

translations.literal: Fan Li advised: 'This cannot be done.

sentences.zh: 臣聞兵者凶器也，戰者逆德也，爭者事之末也。

translations.literal: I have heard that weapons are instruments of ill omen, warfare goes against virtue, and contention is the lowest of affairs.

sentences.zh: 陰謀逆德，好用凶器，試身於所末，上帝禁之，行者不利。」

translations.literal: To scheme in secret, go against virtue, and delight in using instruments of ill omen, testing oneself in the lowest affairs - Heaven forbids this, and those who proceed will not prosper.'

sentences.zh: 越王曰：「吾已決之矣。」

translations.literal: The Yue king said: 'I have already decided.'

sentences.zh: 遂興師。

translations.literal: He raised troops.

sentences.zh: 吳王聞之，悉發精兵擊越，敗之夫椒。

translations.literal: The Wu king heard this and sent all his elite troops to attack Yue, defeating them at Fu Jiao.

sentences.zh: 越王乃以餘兵五千人保棲於會稽。

translations.literal: The Yue king then took his remaining five thousand troops to defend Mount Kuaiji.

sentences.zh: 吳王追而圍之。

translations.literal: The Wu king pursued and besieged them.

In the third year, Goujian heard that King Fu Chai of Wu was training his troops day and night, intending to avenge himself on Yue. Yue wanted to strike first before Wu could mobilize. Fan Li advised: 'This cannot be done. I have heard that weapons are instruments of ill omen, warfare goes against virtue, and contention is the lowest of affairs. To scheme in secret, go against virtue, and delight in using instruments of ill omen, testing oneself in the lowest affairs - Heaven forbids this, and those who proceed will not prosper.' The Yue king said: 'I have already decided.' He raised troops. The Wu king heard this and sent all his elite troops to attack Yue, defeating them at Fu Jiao. The Yue king then took his remaining five thousand troops to defend Mount Kuaiji. The Wu king pursued and besieged them.

sentences.zh: 越王謂范蠡曰：「以不聽子故至於此，為之柰何？」

translations.literal: The Yue king said to Fan Li: 'Because I did not listen to you, we have come to this. What should we do?'

sentences.zh: 蠡對曰：「持滿者與天，定傾者與人，節事者以地。

translations.literal: Li replied: 'Those who hold fullness ally with Heaven, those who right the overturned ally with men, those who manage affairs ally with the earth.

sentences.zh: 卑辭厚禮以遺之，不許，而身與之市。」

translations.literal: Send humble words and generous gifts to them. If they do not agree, then offer yourself and your family as servants.'

sentences.zh: 句踐曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Goujian said: 'Agreed.'

sentences.zh: 乃令大夫種行成於吳，膝行頓首曰：「君王亡臣句踐使陪臣種敢告下執事：句踐請為臣，妻為妾。」

translations.literal: He ordered the grand master Wen Zhong to negotiate peace with Wu, crawling on his knees and knocking his head on the ground, saying: 'Your servant Goujian, the fugitive king, sends his humble servant Wen Zhong to dare inform your attendants: Goujian requests to become your servant, and his wife to become your concubine.'

sentences.zh: 吳王將許之。

translations.literal: The Wu king was about to agree.

sentences.zh: 子胥言於吳王曰：「天以越賜吳，勿許也。」

translations.literal: Wu Zixu spoke to the Wu king: 'Heaven has given Yue to Wu - do not agree.'

sentences.zh: 種還，以報句踐。

translations.literal: Wen Zhong returned and reported to Goujian.

sentences.zh: 句踐欲殺妻子，燔寶器，觸戰以死。

translations.literal: Goujian wanted to kill his wife and children, burn his treasures, and fight to the death.

sentences.zh: 種止句踐曰：「夫吳太宰嚭貪，可誘以利，請閒行言之。」

translations.literal: Wen Zhong stopped Goujian, saying: 'The Wu prime minister Pi is greedy and can be tempted with profit. Let me secretly go and speak to him.'

sentences.zh: 於是句踐以美女寶器令種閒獻吳太宰嚭。

translations.literal: Thus Goujian sent beautiful women and precious treasures through Wen Zhong to secretly offer to Prime Minister Pi of Wu.

sentences.zh: 嚭受，乃見大夫種於吳王。

translations.literal: Pi accepted them, then introduced Wen Zhong to the Wu king.

sentences.zh: 種頓首言曰：「願大王赦句踐之罪，盡入其寶器。

translations.literal: Wen Zhong knocked his head on the ground and said: 'I hope the Great King will pardon Goujian's crimes and accept all his precious treasures.

sentences.zh: 不幸不赦，句踐將盡殺其妻子，燔其寶器，悉五千人觸戰，必有當也。」

translations.literal: If unfortunately you do not pardon him, Goujian will kill all his wife and children, burn his precious treasures, and with his five thousand men fight to the death - surely some will strike their mark.'

sentences.zh: 嚭因說吳王曰：「越以服為臣，若將赦之，此國之利也。」

translations.literal: Pi then persuaded the Wu king: 'Yue has submitted to become servants. If you pardon them, it will be advantageous to the state.'

sentences.zh: 吳王將許之。

translations.literal: The Wu king was about to agree.

sentences.zh: 子胥進諫曰：「今不滅越，後必悔之。

translations.literal: Wu Zixu remonstrated: 'If we do not destroy Yue now, we will surely regret it later.

sentences.zh: 句踐賢君，種、蠡良臣，若反國，將為亂。」

translations.literal: Goujian is a worthy ruler, Wen Zhong and Fan Li are capable ministers. If they return to their country, they will cause trouble.'

sentences.zh: 吳王弗聽，卒赦越，罷兵而歸。

translations.literal: The Wu king did not listen and finally pardoned Yue, withdrawing his troops and returning.

The Yue king said to Fan Li: 'Because I did not listen to you, we have come to this. What should we do?' Li replied: 'Those who hold fullness ally with Heaven, those who right the overturned ally with men, those who manage affairs ally with the earth. Send humble words and generous gifts to them. If they do not agree, then offer yourself and your family as servants.' Goujian said: 'Agreed.' He ordered the grand master Wen Zhong to negotiate peace with Wu, crawling on his knees and knocking his head on the ground, saying: 'Your servant Goujian, the fugitive king, sends his humble servant Wen Zhong to dare inform your attendants: Goujian requests to become your servant, and his wife to become your concubine.' The Wu king was about to agree. Wu Zixu spoke to the Wu king: 'Heaven has given Yue to Wu - do not agree.' Wen Zhong returned and reported to Goujian. Goujian wanted to kill his wife and children, burn his treasures, and fight to the death. Wen Zhong stopped Goujian, saying: 'The Wu prime minister Pi is greedy and can be tempted with profit. Let me secretly go and speak to him.' Thus Goujian sent beautiful women and precious treasures through Wen Zhong to secretly offer to Prime Minister Pi of Wu. Pi accepted them, then introduced Wen Zhong to the Wu king. Wen Zhong knocked his head on the ground and said: 'I hope the Great King will pardon Goujian's crimes and accept all his precious treasures. If unfortunately you do not pardon him, Goujian will kill all his wife and children, burn his precious treasures, and with his five thousand men fight to the death - surely some will strike their mark.' Pi then persuaded the Wu king: 'Yue has submitted to become servants. If you pardon them, it will be advantageous to the state.' The Wu king was about to agree. Wu Zixu remonstrated: 'If we do not destroy Yue now, we will surely regret it later. Goujian is a worthy ruler, Wen Zhong and Fan Li are capable ministers. If they return to their country, they will cause trouble.' The Wu king did not listen and finally pardoned Yue, withdrawing his troops and returning.

sentences.zh: 句踐之困會稽也，喟然嘆曰：「吾終於此乎？」

translations.literal: When Goujian was trapped at Kuaiji, he sighed deeply: 'Will I end here?'

sentences.zh: 種曰：「湯系夏臺，文王囚羑里，晉重耳奔翟，齊小白奔莒，其卒王霸。

translations.literal: Wen Zhong said: 'Tang was imprisoned at Xia Tai, King Wen was held at You Li, Chong Er fled to Di, Xiao Bai fled to Ju - in the end they became kings and hegemons.

sentences.zh: 由是觀之，何遽不為福乎？」

translations.literal: From this perspective, why would it not turn to good fortune?'

When Goujian was trapped at Kuaiji, he sighed deeply: 'Will I end here?' Wen Zhong said: 'Tang was imprisoned at Xia Tai, King Wen was held at You Li, Chong Er fled to Di, Xiao Bai fled to Ju - in the end they became kings and hegemons. From this perspective, why would it not turn to good fortune?'

sentences.zh: 吳既赦越，越王句踐反國，乃苦身焦思，置膽於坐，坐臥即仰膽，飲食亦嘗膽也。

translations.literal: After Wu pardoned Yue, King Goujian of Yue returned to his country. He tormented his body and concentrated his thoughts, placing a gallbladder on his seat. Whether sitting or lying down, he would look up at the gallbladder; even when eating or drinking, he would taste the gallbladder.

sentences.zh: 曰：「女忘會稽之恥邪？」

translations.literal: He would say: 'Have you forgotten the humiliation of Kuaiji?'

sentences.zh: 身自耕作，夫人自織，食不加肉，衣不重采，折節下賢人，厚遇賓客，振貧弔死，與百姓同其勞。

translations.literal: He personally plowed the fields, his wife personally wove cloth. Their food was not supplemented with meat, their clothing did not have multiple layers. He humbled himself before worthy people, treated guests generously, aided the poor and mourned the dead, sharing the labors with the common people.

sentences.zh: 欲使范蠡治國政，蠡對曰：「兵甲之事，種不如蠡；

translations.literal: He wanted to have Fan Li manage the state administration, but Li replied: 'For military affairs, Wen Zhong is not as good as me;

sentences.zh: 填撫國家，親附百姓，蠡不如種。」

translations.literal: for filling and comforting the state, winning over the people, I am not as good as Wen Zhong.'

sentences.zh: 於是舉國政屬大夫種，而使范蠡與大夫柘稽行成，為質於吳。

translations.literal: Thus he entrusted all state affairs to Grand Master Wen Zhong, and sent Fan Li and Grand Master Zhu Ji to negotiate peace and serve as hostages in Wu.

sentences.zh: 二歲而吳歸蠡。

translations.literal: After two years, Wu returned Fan Li.

After Wu pardoned Yue, King Goujian of Yue returned to his country. He tormented his body and concentrated his thoughts, placing a gallbladder on his seat. Whether sitting or lying down, he would look up at the gallbladder; even when eating or drinking, he would taste the gallbladder. He would say: 'Have you forgotten the humiliation of Kuaiji?' He personally plowed the fields, his wife personally wove cloth. Their food was not supplemented with meat, their clothing did not have multiple layers. He humbled himself before worthy people, treated guests generously, aided the poor and mourned the dead, sharing the labors with the common people. He wanted to have Fan Li manage the state administration, but Li replied: 'For military affairs, Wen Zhong is not as good as me; for filling and comforting the state, winning over the people, I am not as good as Wen Zhong.' Thus he entrusted all state affairs to Grand Master Wen Zhong, and sent Fan Li and Grand Master Zhu Ji to negotiate peace and serve as hostages in Wu. After two years, Wu returned Fan Li.

sentences.zh: 句踐自會稽歸七年，拊循其士民，欲用以報吳。

translations.literal: Seven years after Goujian returned from Kuaiji, he comforted and cared for his officers and people, intending to use them to avenge Wu.

sentences.zh: 大夫逢同諫曰：「國新流亡，今乃復殷給，繕飾備利，吳必懼，懼則難必至。

translations.literal: The Yue people were hungry for revenge, but Goujian was afraid they would be too hasty and not yet ready.

sentences.zh: 且鷙鳥之擊也，必匿其形。

translations.literal: Moreover, when fierce birds strike, they must hide their form.

sentences.zh: 今夫吳兵加齊、晉，怨深於楚、越，名高天下，實害周室，德少而功多，必淫自矜。

translations.literal: Now Wu has attacked Qi and Jin, its resentment runs deep against Chu and Yue, its name is high in the world, but in reality it harms the Zhou royal house, its virtue is little but its achievements many, it will certainly become arrogant and self-conceited.

sentences.zh: 為越計，莫若結齊，親楚，附晉，以厚吳。

translations.literal: For Yue to plan, nothing is better than allying with Qi, befriending Chu, attaching to Jin, to strengthen Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳之志廣，必輕戰。

translations.literal: After another year, he asked again. Fan Li replied: 'Not yet.'

sentences.zh: 是我連其權，三國伐之，越承其弊，可克也。」

translations.literal: After another year, he asked again. Fan Li replied: 'Not yet.'

sentences.zh: 句踐曰：「善。」

translations.literal: When he asked a fourth time, Fan Li said: 'Now we can.'

Seven years after Goujian returned from Kuaiji, he comforted and cared for his officers and people, intending to use them to avenge Wu. The Yue people were hungry for revenge, but Goujian was afraid they would be too hasty and not yet ready. He tested them by drinking from a cup of foul water. When someone grimaced, he had them executed, saying: 'You cannot even bear foul water - how can you bear the great humiliation?' He asked his ministers: 'Can we attack Wu now?' Fan Li said: 'Not yet.' After another year, he asked again. Fan Li replied: 'Not yet.' After another year, he asked again. Fan Li replied: 'Not yet.' When he asked a fourth time, Fan Li said: 'Now we can.'

sentences.zh: 居二年，吳王將伐齊。

translations.literal: Wu was unprepared and suffered a great defeat.

sentences.zh: 子胥諫曰：「未可。

translations.literal: Wu Zixu remonstrated saying: "Not yet."

sentences.zh: 臣聞句踐食不重味，與百姓同苦樂。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Wu and Yue fought at Zhe Xiang, and Yue defeated Wu.

sentences.zh: 此人不死，必為國患。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Yue again attacked Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳有越，腹心之疾，齊與吳，疥癬也。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, King Fu Chai of Wu heard that Yue was training troops, and was about to attack Yue.

sentences.zh: 願王釋齊先越。」

translations.literal: I wish the king release Qi first then Yue."

sentences.zh: 吳王弗聽，遂伐齊，敗之艾陵，虜齊高、國以歸。

translations.literal: Wu did not listen and sent troops to attack Yue, suffering another defeat.

sentences.zh: 讓子胥。

translations.literal: Yield to Wu Zixu.

sentences.zh: 子胥曰：「王毋喜！」

translations.literal: Wu Zixu said: "King do not rejoice!"

sentences.zh: 王怒，子胥欲自殺，王聞而止之。

translations.literal: He slit his own throat and died. The fisherman took his body and fled.

sentences.zh: 越大夫種曰：「臣觀吳王政驕矣，請試嘗之貸粟，以卜其事。」

translations.literal: Fu Chai returned and had the body exhumed, making a leather bag from Wu Zixu's skin.

sentences.zh: 請貸，吳王欲與，子胥諫勿與，王遂與之，越乃私喜。

translations.literal: Please lend grain, Wu king wished to give it, Wu Zixu remonstrated not to give, king then gave it, Yue secretly rejoiced.

sentences.zh: 子胥言曰：「王不聽諫，後三年吳其墟乎！」

translations.literal: King Fu Chai of Wu said to his attendants: 'I regret not listening to Wu Zixu's words!'

sentences.zh: 太宰嚭聞之，乃數與子胥爭越議，因讒子胥曰：「伍員貌忠而實忍人，其父兄不顧，安能顧王？

translations.literal: Tai Zai Kui heard it, then frequently contended with Wu Zixu over Yue matters, because slandered Wu Zixu saying: "Wu Yuan appears loyal but is actually cruel, his father and elder brother he did not care for, how can he care for the king?

sentences.zh: 王前欲伐齊，員彊諫，已而有功，用是反怨王。

translations.literal: Goujian wanted to live with Fu Chai in Yue, but Fan Li wrote to advise him: 'Fly a bird until its feathers are complete, then shoot it; catch a rabbit, then release the dogs. A defeated army can be revived, a destroyed state can be restored. The enemy of an enemy is a friend.'

sentences.zh: 王不備伍員，員必為亂。」

translations.literal: Goujian did not listen and kept Fu Chai.

sentences.zh: 與逢同共謀，讒之王。

translations.literal: With Peng Tong together plotted, slandered him to the king.

sentences.zh: 王始不從，乃使子胥於齊，聞其託子於鮑氏，王乃大怒，曰：「伍員果欺寡人！」

translations.literal: King initially not listen, then sent Wu Zixu to Qi, heard he entrusted his son to Bao clan, king greatly angered, said: "Wu Yuan indeed deceived me!"

sentences.zh: 役反，使人賜子胥屬鏤劍以自殺。

translations.literal: Then returned, made person grant Wu Zixu linked sword to commit suicide.

sentences.zh: 子胥大笑曰：「我令而父霸，我又立若，若初欲分吳國半予我，我不受，已，今若反以讒誅我。

translations.literal: Wu Zixu laughed loudly saying: "I made your father hegemon, I again established you, you initially wished to divide Wu state half to give me, I did not accept, now you instead slander to execute me.

sentences.zh: 嗟乎，嗟乎，一人固不能獨立！」

translations.literal: Alas, alas, one person indeed cannot stand alone!"

sentences.zh: 報使者曰：「必取吾眼置吳東門，以觀越兵入也！」

translations.literal: Goujian pardoned him and gave him a house at Shi Men.

sentences.zh: 於是吳任嚭政。

translations.literal: Later, Fu Chai asked permission to see Goujian.

Wu was unprepared and suffered a great defeat. In the tenth year, Yue again attacked Wu, capturing Wu territory west of the Jiang River. In the eleventh year, Wu and Yue fought at Zhe Xiang, and Yue defeated Wu. In the twelfth year, Yue again attacked Wu. In the thirteenth year, King Fu Chai of Wu heard that Yue was training troops, and was about to attack Yue. But Wu Zixu advised: 'Do not attack yet. Yue is still mourning their dead and has not recovered.' Wu did not listen and sent troops to attack Yue, suffering another defeat. Wu Zixu saw that the state could not be saved, so he gave his son to a fisherman and fled. The fisherman rowed him across the river, but Wu Zixu turned back and saw a fisherman pursuing him, so he drew his sword and said: 'The Wu king wants my head - you can take it and receive the reward.' He slit his own throat and died. The fisherman took his body and fled. Fu Chai returned and had the body exhumed, making a leather bag from Wu Zixu's skin. In the fourteenth year, Yue destroyed Wu. King Fu Chai of Wu said to his attendants: 'I regret not listening to Wu Zixu's words!' He covered his face and died. Yue took Fu Chai as a prisoner. Goujian wanted to live with Fu Chai in Yue, but Fan Li wrote to advise him: 'Fly a bird until its feathers are complete, then shoot it; catch a rabbit, then release the dogs. A defeated army can be revived, a destroyed state can be restored. The enemy of an enemy is a friend.' Goujian did not listen and kept Fu Chai. Later, Yue moved its capital to Lang Ye, and Goujian toured the Wu region, proclaiming: 'This was the territory of Fu Chai.' He had Fu Chai pull his chariot, saying: 'You are Fu Chai?' Fu Chai said: 'Yes.' Goujian said: 'I made you a servant - can you still be king?' Fu Chai said: 'Cannot.' Goujian pardoned him and gave him a house at Shi Men. Later, Fu Chai asked permission to see Goujian.

sentences.zh: 居三年，句踐召范蠡曰：「吳已殺子胥，導諛者眾，可乎？」

translations.literal: Goujian went to see him. Fu Chai looked up at Goujian and sighed: 'I was once king of Wu, and you were once king of Yue. Now I pull your chariot. Heaven brings this about - what can man do?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「未可。」

translations.literal: He then committed suicide by hanging himself.

Goujian went to see him. Fu Chai looked up at Goujian and sighed: 'I was once king of Wu, and you were once king of Yue. Now I pull your chariot. Heaven brings this about - what can man do?' He then committed suicide by hanging himself.

sentences.zh: 至明年春，吳王北會諸侯於黃池，吳國精兵從王，惟獨老弱與太子留守。

translations.literal: Fan Li became ill and wrote to Goujian: 'When governing a country, one should stop when success is achieved. When stretching a bow, one should loosen it when it is fully drawn. A flying bird should be shot when its feathers are complete. When the moon is full, it begins to wane; when things reach their peak, they decline.

sentences.zh: 句踐復問范蠡，蠡曰「可矣」。

translations.literal: I have heard that those who know when to stop avoid danger. Now Yue has avenged its humiliation, and the world knows your virtue. This is the time to stop.'

sentences.zh: 乃發習流二千人，教士四萬人，君子六千人，諸御千人，伐吳。

translations.literal: Then sent two thousand trained criminals, taught four myriads soldiers, six thousand nobles, thousand charioteers, attacked Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳師敗，遂殺吳太子。

translations.literal: Wu troops defeated, then killed Wu crown prince.

sentences.zh: 吳告急於王，王方會諸侯於黃池，懼天下聞之，乃祕之。

translations.literal: He sent someone to tell Wen Zhong, but Wen Zhong refused, saying: 'Setting up a ruler is like setting up a cornerstone - if it is not level, the whole building will collapse. Serving a ruler is like building a house - if it is not completed, one cannot stop.'

sentences.zh: 吳王已盟黃池，乃使人厚禮以請成越。

translations.literal: Wu king already allied at Huang Chi, then made person with thick gifts request peace with Yue.

sentences.zh: 越自度亦未能滅吳，乃與吳平。

translations.literal: Goujian heard this and said: 'I had no one to share the country with.'

Fan Li became ill and wrote to Goujian: 'When governing a country, one should stop when success is achieved. When stretching a bow, one should loosen it when it is fully drawn. A flying bird should be shot when its feathers are complete. When the moon is full, it begins to wane; when things reach their peak, they decline. I have heard that those who know when to stop avoid danger. Now Yue has avenged its humiliation, and the world knows your virtue. This is the time to stop.' He then resigned his position and left. Goujian said: 'Wen Zhong can manage internal affairs - I will share the country with him.' He sent someone to tell Wen Zhong, but Wen Zhong refused, saying: 'Setting up a ruler is like setting up a cornerstone - if it is not level, the whole building will collapse. Serving a ruler is like building a house - if it is not completed, one cannot stop.' He then committed suicide. Goujian heard this and said: 'I had no one to share the country with.'

sentences.zh: 其後四年，越復伐吳。

translations.literal: He then buried Wen Zhong generously.

sentences.zh: 吳士民罷弊，輕銳盡死於齊、晉。

translations.literal: Goujian ruled over Wu and Yue, becoming hegemon of the east.

sentences.zh: 而越大破吳，因而留圍之三年，吳師敗，越遂復棲吳王於姑蘇之山。

translations.literal: He sent his younger son to serve the Zhou king, and the Zhou king honored him as a duke.

sentences.zh: 吳王使公孫雄肉袒膝行而前，請成越王曰：「孤臣夫差敢布腹心，異日嘗得罪於會稽，夫差不敢逆命，得與君王成以歸。

translations.literal: Wu king made Gong Sun Xiong bare flesh kneel walk forward, request peace with Yue king saying: "Orphan minister Fu Chai dares lay bare his heart, formerly once offended at Hui Ji, Fu Chai dared not go against command, obtained with jun wang make peace to return.

sentences.zh: 今君王舉玉趾而誅孤臣，孤臣惟命是聽，意者亦欲如會稽之赦孤臣之罪乎？」

translations.literal: Now jun wang raises jade feet to execute orphan minister, orphan minister only obeys command, perhaps also wishes like Hui Ji pardon orphan minister crime?"

sentences.zh: 句踐不忍，欲許之。

translations.literal: After five generations, Yue was destroyed by Chu.

sentences.zh: 范蠡曰：「會稽之事，天以越賜吳，吳不取。

translations.literal: The Yue people said: 'The mountains and rivers are the same, but the people have changed.'

sentences.zh: 今天以吳賜越，越其可逆天乎？

translations.literal: Therefore they sang: 'The mountains do not move, the rivers do not flow, but the people change their ways.'

sentences.zh: 且夫君王蚤朝晏罷，非為吳邪？

translations.literal: Moreover, has Your Majesty risen early and retired late not for Wu's sake?

sentences.zh: 謀之二十二年，一旦而棄之，可乎？

translations.literal: We plotted for twenty-two years, and now abandon it in a day - can this be done?

sentences.zh: 且夫天與弗取，反受其咎。

translations.literal: Moreover, Heaven gives and one does not take - instead one receives the blame.

sentences.zh: 『伐柯者其則不遠』，君忘會稽之蚯？」

translations.literal: 'Those who cut firewood follow the pattern that is not far' - have you forgotten the shame of Kuaiji?'

sentences.zh: 句踐曰：「吾欲聽子言，吾不忍其使者。」

translations.literal: Goujian said: 'I want to listen to your words, but I cannot bear to see the envoy harmed.'

sentences.zh: 范蠡乃鼓進兵，曰：「王已屬政於執事，使者去，不者且得罪。」

translations.literal: Fan Li then urged the advance of troops, saying: 'The king has entrusted government to you officials. Let the envoy leave, otherwise he will be guilty.'

sentences.zh: 吳使者泣而去。

translations.literal: The Wu envoy wept and left.

sentences.zh: 句踐憐之，乃使人謂吳王曰：「吾置王甬東，君百家。」

translations.literal: Goujian pitied him and sent someone to tell the Wu king: 'I will place you in Yong Dong, with a hundred families to serve you.'

sentences.zh: 吳王謝曰：「吾老矣，不能事君王！」

translations.literal: The Wu king declined, saying: 'I am old and cannot serve Your Majesty!'

sentences.zh: 遂自殺。

translations.literal: He then committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 乃蔽其面，曰：「吾無面以見子胥也！」

translations.literal: He covered his face, saying: 'I have no face to see Wu Zixu!'

sentences.zh: 越王乃葬吳王而誅太宰嚭。

translations.literal: The Yue king then buried the Wu king and executed Prime Minister Pi.

He then buried Wen Zhong generously. Goujian ruled over Wu and Yue, becoming hegemon of the east. He sent his younger son to serve the Zhou king, and the Zhou king honored him as a duke. Goujian died, and his younger son succeeded him. His younger son was not worthy, and the state declined. After five generations, Yue was destroyed by Chu. The Yue people said: 'The mountains and rivers are the same, but the people have changed.' Therefore they sang: 'The mountains do not move, the rivers do not flow, but the people change their ways.' Moreover, has Your Majesty risen early and retired late not for Wu's sake? We plotted for twenty-two years, and now abandon it in a day - can this be done? Moreover, Heaven gives and one does not take - instead one receives the blame. 'Those who cut firewood follow the pattern that is not far' - have you forgotten the shame of Kuaiji?' Goujian said: 'I want to listen to your words, but I cannot bear to see the envoy harmed.' Fan Li then urged the advance of troops, saying: 'The king has entrusted government to you officials. Let the envoy leave, otherwise he will be guilty.' The Wu envoy wept and left. Goujian pitied him and sent someone to tell the Wu king: 'I will place you in Yong Dong, with a hundred families to serve you.' The Wu king declined, saying: 'I am old and cannot serve Your Majesty!' He then committed suicide. He covered his face, saying: 'I have no face to see Wu Zixu!' The Yue king then buried the Wu king and executed Prime Minister Pi.

sentences.zh: 句踐已平吳，乃以兵北渡淮，與齊、晉諸侯會於徐州，致貢於周。

translations.literal: After Goujian had pacified Wu, he led troops north across the Huai River and met with the feudal lords of Qi and Jin at Xu Province, presenting tribute to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周元王使人賜句踐胙，命為伯。

translations.literal: King Yuan of Zhou sent someone to grant Goujian sacrificial meat and appoint him as a marquess.

sentences.zh: 句踐已去，渡淮南，以淮上地與楚，歸吳所侵宋地於宋，與魯泗東方百里。

translations.literal: After Goujian left, he crossed south of the Huai and gave the land north of the Huai to Chu, returned the territory Wu had taken from Song to Song, and gave a hundred li east of the Si River to Lu.

sentences.zh: 當是時，越兵橫行於江、淮東，諸侯畢賀，號稱霸王。

translations.literal: At this time, Yue troops marched horizontally through the Jiang and Huai east regions. All the feudal lords congratulated him, and he was called the Hegemon King.

After Goujian had pacified Wu, he led troops north across the Huai River and met with the feudal lords of Qi and Jin at Xu Province, presenting tribute to Zhou. King Yuan of Zhou sent someone to grant Goujian sacrificial meat and appoint him as a marquess. After Goujian left, he crossed south of the Huai and gave the land north of the Huai to Chu, returned the territory Wu had taken from Song to Song, and gave a hundred li east of the Si River to Lu. At this time, Yue troops marched horizontally through the Jiang and Huai east regions. All the feudal lords congratulated him, and he was called the Hegemon King.

sentences.zh: 范蠡遂去，自齊遺大夫種書曰：「蜚鳥盡，良弓藏；

translations.literal: Fan Li then left and sent a letter to Wen Zhong from Qi: 'When the birds are all shot down, the good bow is put away;

sentences.zh: 狡兔死，走狗烹。

translations.literal: when the cunning rabbit dies, the running dogs are cooked.

sentences.zh: 越王為人長頸鳥喙，可與共患難，不可與共樂。

translations.literal: The Yue king has a long neck and bird-like beak - he can be shared with in hardship, but not in pleasure.

sentences.zh: 子何不去？」

translations.literal: Why do you not leave?'

sentences.zh: 種見書，稱病不朝。

translations.literal: Wen Zhong saw the letter and feigned illness without attending court.

sentences.zh: 人或讒種且作亂，越王乃賜種劍曰：「子教寡人伐吳七術，寡人用其三而敗吳，其四在子，子為我從先王試之。」

translations.literal: Someone slandered Wen Zhong, saying he was about to rebel. The Yue king sent him a sword, saying: 'You taught me seven strategies to attack Wu. I used three and defeated Wu. The four remaining are in you. Be my precursor to test them with the former kings.'

sentences.zh: 種遂自殺。

translations.literal: Wen Zhong then committed suicide.

Fan Li then left and sent a letter to Wen Zhong from Qi: 'When the birds are all shot down, the good bow is put away; when the cunning rabbit dies, the running dogs are cooked. The Yue king has a long neck and bird-like beak - he can be shared with in hardship, but not in pleasure. Why do you not leave?' Wen Zhong saw the letter and feigned illness without attending court. Someone slandered Wen Zhong, saying he was about to rebel. The Yue king sent him a sword, saying: 'You taught me seven strategies to attack Wu. I used three and defeated Wu. The four remaining are in you. Be my precursor to test them with the former kings.' Wen Zhong then committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 句踐卒，子王鼫與立。

translations.literal: Goujian died, and his son Wang Pi succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 王鼫與卒，子王不壽立。

translations.literal: Wang Pi died, and his son Wang Bu Shou succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 王不壽卒，子王翁立。

translations.literal: Wang Bu Shou died, and his son Wang Weng succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 王翁卒，子王翳立。

translations.literal: Wang Weng died, and his son Wang Yi succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 王翳卒，子王之侯立。

translations.literal: Wang Yi died, and his son Wang Zhi Hou succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 王之侯卒，子王無彊立。

translations.literal: Wang Zhi Hou died, and his son Wang Wu Qiang succeeded him.

Goujian died, and his son Wang Pi succeeded him. Wang Pi died, and his son Wang Bu Shou succeeded him. Wang Bu Shou died, and his son Wang Weng succeeded him. Wang Weng died, and his son Wang Yi succeeded him. Wang Yi died, and his son Wang Zhi Hou succeeded him. Wang Zhi Hou died, and his son Wang Wu Qiang succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 王無彊時，越興師北伐齊，西伐楚，與中國爭彊。

translations.literal: During Wang Wu Qiang's time, Yue raised troops to attack Qi in the north and attack Chu in the west, contending for power with the central states.

sentences.zh: 當楚威王之時，越北伐齊，齊威王使人說越王曰：「越不伐楚，大不王，小不伯。

translations.literal: During King Wei of Chu's time, Yue attacked Qi in the north. King Wei of Qi sent someone to persuade the Yue king: 'If Yue does not attack Chu, it cannot become a great king or even a small hegemon.

sentences.zh: 圖越之所為不伐楚者，為不得晉也。

translations.literal: I suspect Yue's reason for not attacking Chu is that it cannot obtain Jin's support.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏固不攻楚。

translations.literal: Han and Wei certainly will not attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 韓之攻楚，覆其軍，殺其將，則葉、陽翟危；

translations.literal: If Han attacks Chu and overturns their army, kills their general, then Ye and Yang Di will be in danger;

sentences.zh: 魏亦覆其軍，殺其將，則陳、上蔡不安。

translations.literal: if Wei also overturns their army and kills their general, then Chen and Shang Cai will be uneasy.

sentences.zh: 故二晉之事越也，不至於覆軍殺將，馬汗之力不效。

translations.literal: Therefore the two Jin states serving Yue would not go so far as to overturn armies and kill generals, nor would they expend their horses' sweat effectively.

sentences.zh: 所重於得晉者何也？」

translations.literal: What is the importance of obtaining Jin's support?'

sentences.zh: 越王曰：「所求於晉者，不至頓刃接兵，而況于攻城圍邑乎？

translations.literal: The Yue king said: 'What I seek from Jin is not to the point of clashing blades and meeting in battle, much less attacking cities and besieging towns.

sentences.zh: 願魏以聚大梁之下，願齊之試兵南陽莒地，以聚常、郯之境，則方城之外不南，淮、泗之閒不東，商、於、析、酈、宗胡之地，夏路以左，不足以備秦，江南、泗上不足以待越矣。

translations.literal: I wish Wei would gather forces below Da Liang, and I wish Qi would test its troops in the southern regions of Ju territory, gathering at the borders of Chang and Tan. Then beyond Fang Cheng they would not go south, between Huai and Si they would not go east, the lands of Shang, Yu, Xi, Li, Zong Hu, and Xia Lu on the left would not be enough to defend against Qin, and south of the Jiang and north of the Si would not be enough to face Yue.

sentences.zh: 則齊、秦、韓、魏得志於楚也，是二晉不戰分地，不耕而穫之。

translations.literal: Then Qi, Qin, Han, and Wei could have their way with Chu - this is the two Jin states dividing land without fighting, harvesting without plowing.

sentences.zh: 不此之為，而頓刃於河山之閒以為齊秦用，所待者如此其失計，柰何其以此王也！」

translations.literal: If they do not do this, but clash blades between the rivers and mountains to serve Qi and Qin, then what they wait for is such a miscalculation. How can they become kings with this!'

sentences.zh: 齊使者曰：「幸也越之不亡也！

translations.literal: The Qi envoy said: 'Fortunately Yue has not perished!

sentences.zh: 吾不貴其用智之如目，見豪毛而不見其睫也。

translations.literal: I do not value their intelligence as sharp as eyes that see fine hairs but miss their own eyelashes.

sentences.zh: 今王知晉之失計，而不自知越之過，是目論也。

translations.literal: Now the king knows Jin's miscalculation but does not know Yue's own faults - this is blindness in discussion.

sentences.zh: 王所待於晉者，非有馬汗之力也，又非可與合軍連和也，將待之以分楚眾也。

translations.literal: What the king awaits from Jin is not the strength of sweating horses, nor can they combine armies and form alliances. He awaits them to divide Chu's forces.

sentences.zh: 今楚眾已分，何待於晉？」

translations.literal: Now Chu's forces are already divided - what is there to await from Jin?'

sentences.zh: 越王曰：「柰何？」

translations.literal: The Yue king said: 'What should I do?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「楚三大夫張九軍，北圍曲沃、於中，以至無假之關者三千七百里，景翠之軍北聚魯、齊、南陽，分有大此者乎？

translations.literal: He replied: 'Chu has three grand masters organizing nine armies, surrounding Qu Wo and Yu Zhong in the north, reaching the pass of Wu Jia - three thousand seven hundred li. Jing Cui's army gathers north at Lu and Qi, south at Nan Yang. Is there anything larger than this?

sentences.zh: 且王之所求者，鬬晉楚也；

translations.literal: Moreover, what the king seeks is to make Jin and Chu fight;

sentences.zh: 晉楚不鬬，越兵不起，是知二五而不知十也。

translations.literal: if Jin and Chu do not fight, Yue troops will not rise - this is knowing two and five but not knowing ten.

sentences.zh: 此時不攻楚，臣以是知越大不王，小不伯。

translations.literal: If they do not attack Chu at this time, I know that Yue cannot become a great king or small hegemon.

sentences.zh: 復讎、龐、長沙，楚之粟也；

translations.literal: Fu Chou, Pang, and Chang Sha are Chu's grain supplies;

sentences.zh: 竟澤陵，楚之材也。

translations.literal: Jing Ze Ling is Chu's timber.

sentences.zh: 越窺兵通無假之關，此四邑者不上貢事於郢矣。

translations.literal: If Yue overlooks the pass of Wu Jia with troops, these four cities will not pay tribute to Ying.

sentences.zh: 臣聞之，圖王不王，其敝可以伯。

translations.literal: I have heard that if one aims for kingship but does not achieve it, the harm can still be hegemony.

sentences.zh: 然而不伯者，王道失也。

translations.literal: However those who do not fear, wang dao is lost.

sentences.zh: 故願大王之轉攻楚也。」

translations.literal: Therefore wish great wang turn attack Chu."

During Wang Wu Qiang's time, Yue raised troops to attack Qi in the north and attack Chu in the west, contending for power with the central states. During King Wei of Chu's time, Yue attacked Qi in the north. King Wei of Qi sent someone to persuade the Yue king: 'If Yue does not attack Chu, it cannot become a great king or even a small hegemon. I suspect Yue's reason for not attacking Chu is that it cannot obtain Jin's support. Han and Wei certainly will not attack Chu. If Han attacks Chu and overturns their army, kills their general, then Ye and Yang Di will be in danger; if Wei also overturns their army and kills their general, then Chen and Shang Cai will be uneasy. Therefore the two Jin states serving Yue would not go so far as to overturn armies and kill generals, nor would they expend their horses' sweat effectively. What is the importance of obtaining Jin's support?' The Yue king said: 'What I seek from Jin is not to the point of clashing blades and meeting in battle, much less attacking cities and besieging towns. I wish Wei would gather forces below Da Liang, and I wish Qi would test its troops in the southern regions of Ju territory, gathering at the borders of Chang and Tan. Then beyond Fang Cheng they would not go south, between Huai and Si they would not go east, the lands of Shang, Yu, Xi, Li, Zong Hu, and Xia Lu on the left would not be enough to defend against Qin, and south of the Jiang and north of the Si would not be enough to face Yue. Then Qi, Qin, Han, and Wei could have their way with Chu - this is the two Jin states dividing land without fighting, harvesting without plowing. If they do not do this, but clash blades between the rivers and mountains to serve Qi and Qin, then what they wait for is such a miscalculation. How can they become kings with this!' The Qi envoy said: 'Fortunately Yue has not perished! I do not value their intelligence as sharp as eyes that see fine hairs but miss their own eyelashes. Now the king knows Jin's miscalculation but does not know Yue's own faults - this is blindness in discussion. What the king awaits from Jin is not the strength of sweating horses, nor can they combine armies and form alliances. He awaits them to divide Chu's forces. Now Chu's forces are already divided - what is there to await from Jin?' The Yue king said: 'What should I do?' He replied: 'Chu has three grand masters organizing nine armies, surrounding Qu Wo and Yu Zhong in the north, reaching the pass of Wu Jia - three thousand seven hundred li. Jing Cui's army gathers north at Lu and Qi, south at Nan Yang. Is there anything larger than this? Moreover, what the king seeks is to make Jin and Chu fight; if Jin and Chu do not fight, Yue troops will not rise - this is knowing two and five but not knowing ten. If they do not attack Chu at this time, I know that Yue cannot become a great king or small hegemon. Fu Chou, Pang, and Chang Sha are Chu's grain supplies; Jing Ze Ling is Chu's timber. If Yue overlooks the pass of Wu Jia with troops, these four cities will not pay tribute to Ying. I have heard that if one aims for kingship but does not achieve it, the harm can still be hegemony. Now Yue aims for kingship but cannot achieve it. If Yue attacks Chu, Chu will be weakened and Qin will be strong. If Qin is strong, it will swallow the three Jin states. The three Jin states being swallowed, Yue cannot face Qin alone. This is Yue's great fault.

sentences.zh: 於是越遂釋齊而伐楚。

translations.literal: If the three Jin states are grateful, they will certainly divide Chu's land with Yue.

sentences.zh: 楚威王興兵而伐之，大敗越，殺王無彊，盡取笔吳地至浙江，北破齊於徐州。

translations.literal: If the three Jin states divide Chu's land with Yue, Chu will certainly resent the three Jin states.

sentences.zh: 而越以此散，諸族子爭立，或為王，或為君，濱於江南海上，服朝於楚。

translations.literal: If Chu resents the three Jin states, the world will certainly submit to Yue.

sentences.zh: 後七世，至閩君搖，佐諸侯平秦。

translations.literal: This is the way to become hegemon.'

sentences.zh: 漢高帝復以搖為越王，以奉越後。

translations.literal: The Yue king followed this advice and allied with Chu to attack Qi, defeating Qi at Gui Lin.

sentences.zh: 東越，閩君，皆其後也。

translations.literal: Qi feared Yue and presented five hundred li of territory to sue for peace.

This is the way to become hegemon.' The Yue king followed this advice and allied with Chu to attack Qi, defeating Qi at Gui Lin. Qi feared Yue and presented five hundred li of territory to sue for peace.

sentences.zh: 范蠡事越王句踐，既苦身力，與句踐深謀二十餘年，竟滅吳，報會稽之恥，北渡兵於淮以臨齊、晉，號令中國，以尊周室，句踐以霸，而范蠡稱上將軍。

translations.literal: Fan Li served Yue king Gou Jian, already labored his body strength, with Gou Jian deeply planned twenty plus years, finally extinguished Wu, avenged Hui Ji humiliation, north crossed troops at Huai to face Qi, Jin, commanded central states, to honor Zhou house, Gou Jian became hegemon, Fan Li titled upper general.

sentences.zh: 還反國，范蠡以為大名之下，難以久居，且句踐為人可與同患，難與處安，為書辭句踐曰：「臣聞主憂臣勞，主辱臣死。

translations.literal: Returned and returned to country, Fan Li considered great name below, difficult to long reside, moreover Gou Jian as person can with share hardship, difficult with dwell peace, made letter bid farewell Gou Jian saying: "Subject heard jun worry subject toil, jun humiliate subject die.

sentences.zh: 昔者君王辱於會稽，所以不死，為此事也。

translations.literal: Yue king Wu Qiang died, and his son Wang Zhu succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 今既以雪恥，臣請從會稽之誅。」

translations.literal: Wang Zhu died, and his son Wang Tui succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 句踐曰：「孤將與子分國而有之。

translations.literal: Wang Tui died, and his son Wang Yue Ren succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 不然，將加誅于子。」

translations.literal: Wang Yue Ren died, and his son Wang Wu Ju succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 范蠡曰：「君行令，臣行意。」

translations.literal: Wang Wu Ju died, and his son Wang Tian succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 乃裝其輕寶珠玉，自與其私徒屬乘舟浮海以行，終不反。

translations.literal: Wang Tian died, and his son Wang Bi Qian succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 於是句踐表會稽山以為范蠡奉邑。

Sima Qian said: Yu's merit was great indeed. He regulated the nine rivers, established the nine provinces, and to this day the various Xia live in peace. His descendant Goujian tormented his body and concentrated his thoughts, finally extinguishing the strong state of Wu, observing his troops northward among the central states, honoring the Zhou house, and being called the Hegemon King. Can Goujian not be called worthy! He truly had Yu's remaining virtue. Fan Li moved three times and each time had glorious fame, his name enduring for later generations. With such ministers and lords, how could they fail to achieve fame!
